page.title: 19THORNHILL THE SMOKE HOUSE
page.content: The Smoke House used to be a meal-mill called Cessintully Mill.The waters which flowed from several upland streams were dammed up until required to flow swiftly and turn the mill wheel.This method is not,of course, used today.Now it is a smoke house,smoking mainly trout and salmon and some eels.The smoke is made by burning oak chips from American whisky barrels;this flavours the fish which are hung up in rows and "cooked" by the smoking.There is a good market for this product today.Hotels and restaurants buy it for their clients.We can buy it at the mill but it is expensive.
